intro: Hibbertia eciliata, commonly known as the slender hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red-tipped petals. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions of Western Australia. Hibbertia eciliata has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the spring and summer months. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and unique appearance.
